thread.title: Gay comedian Tammy Brown says he might end up with a woman
thread.title_full: Gay comedian Tammy Brown says he might end up with a woman

author: cabanilla
title: Gay comedian Tammy Brown says he might end up with a woman
text:
By: Clarizel Abanilla - Entertainment Correspondent / @CAbanillaINQ INQUIRER.net / 07:38 PM February 23, 2017 Tammy Brown on Inquirer ShowbizLive. Image: Clarizel Abanilla 
It could be quite an unusual view for a typical gay guy, but comedian Tammy Brown eyes ending up with a woman rather than a man. 
In his February 22 guesting on Inquirer ShowbizLive, the comedian revealed that while he may be openly gay, he sees himself choosing a woman to raise his own family. 
“Yes [I might end up with a woman]. ‘Yung utak ko nagfo- focus na magkaroon ako ng pamilya (My mind is bent on having a family of my own),” he said. ADVERTISEMENT 
The comedian who hails from San Pablo, Laguna said he has experienced all sorts of relationships, being with men and women in the past. 
Surprisingly, despite dressing up in such a way that no one would doubt his sexual preference, that is being gay, he says women, even lesbians, fall for him and pursue him. 
“ Lahat po ng relasyon na -experience ko na, ako ‘yung bading na hindi masyado matyaga sa lalaki. Nahihiya ako (I’ve been through all kinds of relationships. I am the kind of gay person who does not pursue guys too much. I’m shy.),” he said. 
He further shared that he does not feel comfortable flirting with guys. 
“ Kung may bet ako, o may crush ako, hindi ko sinasabi. Hindi ako pala- boyfriend. Tamang harot lang (If I like a guy or I have a crush on someone, I do not tell. I don’t frequently engage in a relationship with a guy. I just flirt a little.),” he added. 
Inquirer ShowbizLive airs every Wednesday, 8 p.m. on Inquirer.net Facebook, Youtube and Periscope. It is also broadcast live on Inquirer Bandera Facebook, RadyoInquirer 990AM and channel 16 or 18 via TV Plus. 
The show is hosted by Inquirer Bandera’s entertainment editor Ervin Santiago and Inquirer.net’s entertainment correspondent Izel Abanilla.
